729468f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Westervelt Avenue
729468f-b.text:
(1)
386 and 396 Richmond Terrace, soth side, between Westervelt Avenue and St. Peters Place. No. 386 (left) appears in Bromley's 19217 map as the West Day and Evening School. From 1874 to 1907 it belonged to the Pendleton family. No. 396 belonged to the Wilkinson family according to the real estate maps of 1874 to 1907.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
(2)
Another view of the two houses, showing, more prominently, No. 396-the Wilkinson house. The view is eastward, the opposite direction from view 1.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
729468f-b.folder: Richmond Terrace & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729468f-a.text:
(1)
386 and 396 Richmond Terrace, soth side, between Westervelt Avenue and St. Peters Place. No. 386 (left) appears in Bromley's 19217 map as the West Day and Evening School. From 1874 to 1907 it belonged to the Pendleton family. No. 396 belonged to the Wilkinson family according to the real estate maps of 1874 to 1907.

729468f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729469f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Westervelt Avenue
729469f-a.text:
404 Richmond Terrace, adjoing the S. E.corner of Westervelt Avenue, showing the Richmond Knights of Columbus clubhouse. In 1907 it belonged to Geo. J. Greenfield, and from 1874 to 1898 to the Wilkinson family. The house is modeled in the Doric Order of Greek architecture. Across the roof of the house appears the steeple of St. Peters R. C. Church.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
729469f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729470f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - Westervelt Avenue
729470f-a.text:
414 Richmond Terrace, at the S.E. corner of Westervelt Avenue. The mansion was on the Brooks estate in 1874; from
1898 to 1907 it belonged to Jas. Crabtree.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
729470f-a.folder: Richmond Terrace & Westervelt Avenue, Staten Island, NY
